Name: 1-naphthylacetic acid production | 1-naphthylacetic acid | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description: 1-Naphthtylacetic acid is prodcuced by reacting naphtalene with chloroacetic acid, catalysed by potassium bromide. A yield of 90% was assumed.;C10H8+C2H3O2Cl+KBr(cat) -> C12H10O2+HCl+KBr(cat);Chemical, organic is used to proxy naphthalene.;Sodium hydroxide is added to neutralize the formed hydrochloric acid. The catalyst in not consider significant in terms of emissions for the reaction and it is therefore not included in the dataset.;Reference(s):;Ogata Y., Ishiguro J., (1950). J. Am. Chem. Soc., 72, 9, 4302.;Mesejo C., Rosito S., Reig C., Martínez-Fuentes A., Agustí M., (2012). Synthetic Auxin 3,5,6-TPA Provokes Citrus clementina (Hort. ex Tan) Fruitlet Abscission by Reducing Photosynthate Availability, Journal of Plant Growth Regulation, 31 (2), 186–194.
